info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 8 at 9:32AM CDT until May 9 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County.
Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties.
Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Walker and Madison Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Polk, Walker and San Jacinto Counties.
For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bedias Creek near Madisonville.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Thursday was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.1 feet on 06/02/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/hgx.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM CDT.
